Fever: Headache about ten AM, with pain in back, ankles and legs increasing until three
Great lassitude, congestion of head, with vertigo, face hot and flushed, prickling sensation all over; restless at night from pain in wrists and knee; rheumatic pains; profuse perspiration

name: Polyporus pinicola
details: Useful in intermittent, remittent and bilious fevers, with headache, yellow tongue, constant nausea, faintness at epigastrium, and constipation. Similar to its botanical relative, POLYP. OFFICINALIS, or BOLETUS LARICIS, Q.V. Deep dull, severe pain in shin bones, preventing sleep.
